title: Who did Hemingway influence? - Quora
tags: Literature of the United States of America

response.answer_text: His influence was widespread, both in terms of his fictional technique and in his iconic notions of what is an American man. The short stories of Raymond Carver, for example, seem very Hemingwayesque, but the use of stripped-down dialogue and short sentences, as well as repetition, show up in so many writers after 1930 or so, that a catalogue will look like a somewhat unfocused list. I even recall, for example, sf writers Harlan Ellison and Robert Silverberg writing and speaking of Hemingway’s technique. Ray Bradbury was definitely a Hemingway fan, and wrote a story about Hemingway. As for the iconic / cliché American man, that shows up even more. It is a common pattern in detective fiction and stories of the west. You can point out examples in James Ellroy, Cormac McCarthy, and Raymond Chandler. Many of these aspects of Hemingway are so recognized, that they have been parodied. International Imitation Hemingway Competition - Wikipedia There are anthologies of the “winners,” called something like “The Best of Bad Hemingway.”

Everybody, including me. Not just his pared-down writing style, but his iceberg theory of withholding information, just showing the tip of the iceberg -- as long as you know everything about the rest of the iceberg, you can leave a lot of it out and the reader will go along with you. Enter a scene at the last possible moment (enter late, leave early). Let much remain unsaid. Thank you, Papa, for everything.
